summary: A guide to getting the most immersive Skyrim possible
descriptionHtml:
Welcome to the Skyrim Total immersion guide

In this guide you will learn how to make your game as realistic and immersive as possible.
I got the idea to make this after reading over STEP, but wanted to take it a bit farther.
I added it here because I know a lot of people only visit the downloads section, and never the forums or such, but I will be adding this to the forums as well.
Don\'t forget to download all the dependencies for the mods, Script Dragon and SKSE are two I know you\'l need.

Credits go to all of the fantastic modders that made these wonderful mods. I\'ve made none of them and I take credit only for making a list of them. Go endorse these mods to support their wonderful creators!


Updates:
4/24 - Been busy at work so I\'ve bound to miss a few good immersion mods, been trying to keep up. Added a few mods to the list and I may have removed a couple, hard to remember when I haven\'t been home much in a week >_<

4/16 - Fixed some grammar mistakes (I wrote it at 4am, sorry bout that ;) )

Added  mods:
Light up the night - People Have Torches
Althirs enhanced companion and drivable carriage commands
Spouse Life
And many more!

Removed mods: SHARPE - Housecarls. Causes housecarls\'s armour to vanish completely. Might work fine on its own, but with the mods in this guide, has errors.

It seems I forgot to add Hypothermia! That was one of the core files! I\'ve updated it now.
author: Hooker Heels
